intro: [WRONG START] Orobush grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered orobush, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are primarily pollinated by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance in local habitats.
